Description: Green glazed composition shabti of Padikhons with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with a beard, crossed hands in relief holding an adze and a hoe, the front of the leg section is inscribed with a panel of incised hieroglyphs; there is a back-pillar and a plinth beneath the foot.
Curator's comments: Sir Hans Sloane’s ‘Miscellanea’ catalogue is a bound volume in Central Archives containing seven separate catalogues: ‘Miscellanies’, ‘Antiquities’, ‘Seals’, ‘Pictures’, ‘Mathematical Instruments’, ‘Agate Handles’ and ‘Agate Cups, Bottles, Spoons’. Each contains numbered entries that list and describe objects collected by Sloane between the 1680s and 1750s. Each catalogue begins with object number one. Text from Sloane Miscellanea catalogue: Miscellanea Antiquities 283 "283. The same."; the same referring to Miscellanea Antiquities 273 "273. A very large Ægyptian idol in blew clay Figlina idola varieæ magnitudinis reperta in mummiarum ventre consuta. Jo: Nard. In Lucret." and to 282 "The same wt. Hieroglyphicks. Isis Vid. no. 679". 679 was a shabti from Gualtier's collection that Sloane catalogued in his Anitquities later.
